responses.content:
```yaml
leads:
  - headline: Potential arbitrary command injection in test/centos-image/gateway.sh
    analysis: |
      The script test/centos-image/gateway.sh uses unvalidated user input to construct command line arguments via string interpolation. Specifically, the `XMODIFIERS` environment variable is interpolated into command arguments without validation. If an attacker can control the value of `XMODIFIERS`, they could potentially inject arbitrary commands to be executed on the system.
    cwe: CWE-77
    function_names:
      - ""
    filenames:
      - test/centos-image/gateway.sh
    classification: very promising

  - headline: Potential hardcoded credentials in test/centos-image/gateway.sh
    analysis: |
      The script test/centos-image/gateway.sh appears to contain hardcoded credentials for etcd in the `sshproxy.yaml` configuration file. Hardcoded credentials pose a security risk as they cannot be easily changed or revoked if compromised.
    cwe: CWE-798
    function_names:
      - ""
    filenames:
      - test/centos-image/gateway.sh
    classification: slightly promising

  - headline: Lack of integrity checks when downloading code
    analysis: |
      The script vendor/google.golang.org/grpc/regenerate.sh downloads code from several external sources without performing any integrity checks (e.g., verifying checksums or signatures). An attacker who can tamper with the downloaded code could potentially inject malicious changes.
    cwe: CWE-494
    function_names:
      - ""
    filenames:
      - vendor/google.golang.org/grpc/regenerate.sh
    classification: very promising

  - headline: Potential directory traversal via path manipulation
    analysis: |
      The scripts in the codebase (e.g., vendor/go.uber.org/zap/checklicense.sh, vendor/github.com/mattn/go-runewidth/go.test.sh) use shell glob patterns to find files in the project directory. An attacker who can control the filenames or paths in the project could potentially exploit this to access files outside the project directory.
    cwe: CWE-22
    function_names:
      - ""
    filenames:
      - vendor/go.uber.org/zap/checklicense.sh
      - vendor/github.com/mattn/go-runewidth/go.test.sh
    classification: slightly promising

  - headline: Insecure usage of temporary files
    analysis: |
      The script vendor/golang.org/x/sys/unix/mkerrors.sh creates temporary files in an insecure way using `mktemp` without specifying a secure directory. An attacker who can predict or influence the temporary file paths could potentially exploit this for symlink attacks or race conditions.
    cwe: CWE-59
    function_names:
      - ""
    filenames:
      - vendor/golang.org/x/sys/unix/mkerrors.sh
    classification: very promising
```

leads.headline: Potential arbitrary command injection in test/centos-image/gateway.sh
leads.analysis: The script test/centos-image/gateway.sh uses unvalidated user input to construct command line arguments via string interpolation. Specifically, the XMODIFIERS environment variable is interpolated into command arguments without validation. If an attacker can control the value of XMODIFIERS, they could potentially inject arbitrary commands to be executed on the system.

leads.headline: Potential hardcoded credentials in test/centos-image/gateway.sh
leads.analysis: The script test/centos-image/gateway.sh appears to contain hardcoded credentials for etcd in the sshproxy.yaml configuration file. Hardcoded credentials pose a security risk as they cannot be easily changed or revoked if compromised.

leads.headline: Lack of integrity checks when downloading code
leads.analysis: The script vendor/google.golang.org/grpc/regenerate.sh downloads code from several external sources without performing any integrity checks (e.g., verifying checksums or signatures). An attacker who can tamper with the downloaded code could potentially inject malicious changes.

leads.headline: Potential directory traversal via path manipulation
leads.analysis: The scripts in the codebase (e.g., vendor/go.uber.org/zap/checklicense.sh, vendor/github.com/mattn/go-runewidth/go.test.sh) use shell glob patterns to find files in the project directory. An attacker who can control the filenames or paths in the project could potentially exploit this to access files outside the project directory.

leads.headline: Insecure usage of temporary files
leads.analysis: The script vendor/golang.org/x/sys/unix/mkerrors.sh creates temporary files in an insecure way using mktemp without specifying a secure directory. An attacker who can predict or influence the temporary file paths could potentially exploit this for symlink attacks or race conditions.
